text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
speaker: Narrator

text: to the saints and faithful brethren in Christ that are at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: We give thanks to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
speaker: Narrator

text: having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which ye have toward all the saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens, whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: which is come unto you; even as it is also in all the world bearing fruit and increasing, as it doth in you also, since the day ye heard and knew the grace of God in truth;
speaker: Narrator

text: even as ye learned of Epaphras our beloved fellow-servant, who is a faithful minister of Christ on our behalf,
speaker: Narrator

text: who also declared unto us your love in the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray and make request for you, that ye may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: to walk worthily of the Lord unto all pleasing, bearing fruit in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: strengthened with all power, according to the might of his glory, unto all patience and longsuffering with joy;
speaker: Narrator

text: giving thanks unto the Father, who made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light;
speaker: Narrator

text: who delivered us out of the power of darkness, and translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love;
speaker: Narrator

text: in whom we have our redemption, the forgiveness of our sins:
speaker: Narrator

text: who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation;
speaker: Narrator

text: for in him were all things created, in the heavens and upon the earth, things visible and things invisible, whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers; all things have been created through him, and unto him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he is before all things, and in him all things consist.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was the good pleasure of the Father that in him should all the fulness dwell;
speaker: Narrator

text: and through him to reconcile all things unto himself, having made peace through the blood of his cross; through him, I say, whether things upon the earth, or things in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, being in time past alienated and enemies in your mind in your evil works,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet now hath he reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and without blemish and unreproveable before him:
speaker: Narrator

text: if so be that ye continue in the faith, grounded and stedfast, and not moved away from the hope of the gospel which ye heard, which was preached in all creation under heaven; whereof I Paul was made a minister.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and fill up on my part that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his bodyâ€™s sake, which is the church;
speaker: Narrator

text: whereof I was made a minister, according to the dispensation of God which was given me to you-ward, to fulfil the word of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: even the mystery which hath been hid for ages and generations: but now hath it been manifested to his saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom God was pleased to make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:
speaker: Narrator

text: whom we proclaim, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: whereunto I labor also, striving according to his working, which worketh in me mightily.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I would have you know how greatly I strive for you, and for them at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh;
speaker: Narrator

text: that their hearts may be comforted, they being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, that they may know the mystery of God, even Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: This I say, that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though I am absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order, and the stedfastness of your faith in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: As therefore ye received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in him,
speaker: Narrator

text: rooted and builded up in him, and established in your faith, even as ye were taught, abounding in thanksgiving.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed lest there shall be any one that maketh spoil of you through his philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: for in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in him ye are made full, who is the head of all principality and power:
speaker: Narrator

text: in whom ye were also circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands, in the putting off of the body of the flesh, in the circumcision of Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: having been buried with him in baptism, wherein ye were also raised with him through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, being dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, you, I say, did he make alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses;
speaker: Narrator

text: having blotted out the bond written in ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us: and he hath taken it out of the way, nailing it to the cross;
speaker: Narrator

text: having despoiled the principalities and the powers, he made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of a feast day or a new moon or a sabbath day:
speaker: Narrator

text: which are a shadow of the things to come; but the body is Christâ€™s.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no man rob you of your prize by a voluntary humility and worshipping of the angels, dwelling in the things which he hath seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not holding fast the Head, from whom all the body, being supplied and knit together through the joints and bands, increaseth with the increase of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye died with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, do ye subject yourselves to ordinances,
speaker: Narrator

text: Handle not, nor taste, nor touch
speaker: Narrator

text: (all which things are to perish with the using), after the precepts and doctrines of men?
speaker: Narrator

text: Which things have indeed a show of wisdom in will-worship, and humility, and severity to the body; but are not of any value against the indulgence of the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: If then ye were raised together with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated on the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set your mind on the things that are above, not on the things that are upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye died, and your life is hid with Christ in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Christ, who is our life, shall be manifested, then shall ye also with him be manifested in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put to death therefore your members which are upon the earth: fornication, uncleanness, passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry;
speaker: Narrator

text: for which thingsâ€™ sake cometh the wrath of God upon the sons of disobedience:
speaker: Narrator

text: wherein ye also once walked, when ye lived in these things;
speaker: Narrator

text: but now do ye also put them all away: anger, wrath, malice, railing, shameful speaking out of your mouth:
speaker: Narrator

text: lie not one to another; seeing that ye have put off the old man with his doings,
speaker: Narrator

text: and have put on the new man, that is being renewed unto knowledge after the image of him that created him:
speaker: Narrator

text: where there cannot be Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondman, freeman; but Christ is all, and in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put on therefore, as Godâ€™s elect, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, meekness, longsuffering;
speaker: Narrator

text: forbearing one another, and forgiving each other, if any man have a complaint against any; even as the Lord forgave you, so also do ye:
speaker: Narrator

text: and above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfectness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, to the which also ye were called in one body; and be ye thankful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly; in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whatsoever ye do, in word or in deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wives, be in subjection to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well-pleasing in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fathers, provoke not your children, that they be not discouraged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Servants, obey in all things them that are your masters according to the flesh; not with eye-service, as men-pleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: whatsoever ye do, work heartily, as unto the Lord, and not unto men;
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that from the Lord ye shall receive the recompense of the inheritance: ye serve the Lord Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that doeth wrong shall receive again for the wrong that he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Masters, render unto your servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Continue stedfastly in prayer, watching therein with thanksgiving;
speaker: Narrator

text: withal praying for us also, that God may open unto us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds;
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your speech be always with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer each one.
speaker: Narrator

text: All my affairs shall Tychicus make known unto you, the beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow-servant in the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: whom I have sent unto you for this very purpose, that ye may know our state, and that he may comfort your hearts;
speaker: Narrator

text: together with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known unto you all things that are done here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aristarchus my fellow-prisoner saluteth you, and Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (touching whom ye received commandments; if he come unto you, receive him),
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesus that is called Justus, who are of the circumcision: these only are my fellow-workers unto the kingdom of God, men that have been a comfort unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, saluteth you, always striving for you in his prayers, that ye may stand perfect and fully assured in all the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I bear him witness, that he hath much labor for you, and for them in Laodicea, and for them in Hierapolis.
speaker: Narrator

text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas salute you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute the brethren that are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church that is in their house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when this epistle hath been read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye also read the epistle from Laodicea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you.
speaker: Narrator
